content: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Laozi

content: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyse you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
author: Bernice Reagon

content: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
author: Lauren Bacall

content: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: The beginning of wisdom is found in doubting; by doubting we come to the question, and by seeking we may come upon the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

content: One needs something to believe in, something for which one can have whole-hearted enthusiasm. One needs to feel that ones life has meaning, that one is needed in this world.
author: Hannah Szenes

content: A thing long expected takes the form of the unexpected when at last it comes.
author: Mark Twain

content: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.
author: Robert Fulghum

content: Four steps to achievement: Plan purposefully. Prepare prayerfully. Proceed positively. Pursue persistently.
author: William Arthur Ward

content: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

content: Anything you really want, you can attain, if you really go after it.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
author: Carl Jung

content: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Imagination disposes of everything; it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals - that is, goals that do not inspire them.
author: Tony Robbins
